rationale: The agent correctly identifies the TODO and provides helpful error messaging, but has two significant issues: (1) It fails to split the string concatenation across lines 60-61 as the ground truth does, keeping 'but lacks a' on line 60 when it should be 'but lacks a transport version definition. ' on line 60. (2) The message phrasing is slightly different ('Run... to create it' vs 'If this is a new transport version, run...'). The ground truth version is clearer because it explicitly conditions the action ('If this is a new transport version'), while the agent's version is more imperative. The agent also doesn't properly format the string concatenation by removing the erroneous linebreak after 'but lacks a'. These differences indicate incomplete understanding of the required change structure.
ground_truth_patch:
diff --git a/build-tools-internal/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/gradle/internal/transport/ValidateTransportVersionReferencesTask.java b/build-tools-internal/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/gradle/internal/transport/ValidateTransportVersionReferencesTask.java
index 6f7319bd4bc..c253b9583e2 100644
--- a/build-tools-internal/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/gradle/internal/transport/ValidateTransportVersionReferencesTask.java
+++ b/build-tools-internal/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/gradle/internal/transport/ValidateTransportVersionReferencesTask.java
@@ -58,8 +58,8 @@ public abstract class ValidateTransportVersionReferencesTask extends DefaultTask
                         + tvReference.name()
                         + "\") was used at "
                         + tvReference.location()
-                        + ", but lacks a"
-                        + " transport version definition. This can be generated with the <TODO> task" // todo
+                        + ", but lacks a transport version definition. "
+                        + "If this is a new transport version, run './gradle generateTransportVersion'."
                 );
             }
         }
